meanings.definition: Characteristic of one person or thing, and so serving to distinguish it from others.
meanings.sent1: Her distinctive laugh could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent2: The distinctive smell of fresh bread filled the bakery.
meanings.sent3: The distinctive hat she wore made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His distinctive style of painting was like a splash of color on a blank canvas.
meanings.sent5: The distinctive sound of the train whistle echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A feature that helps to identify, tell apart, or describe.
meanings.sent1: The fingerprint was a distinctive mark left at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: The distinctive on the package helped the courier deliver it to the right address.
meanings.sent3: The distinctive on the map led them to the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her distinctive in the story was like a clue that solved the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The distinctive of the logo made the brand instantly recognizable.
